column4: hi.  is there some way I can find out how much RAM is in a laptop running ubuntu?
free -m
that tells me 2986 total.  the laptop was sold as having 4GB.  what could be up?
you running a 32bit OS?
I'm running ubuntu - I guess it's 32bit
is yuor CPU 64bit?
it's an Core Duo T6600
I don't know how to count its bits
but 4GB is only 2^32 I think, so 32 bits are enough to address it?
makes sense, ive seen some 32bit systems only see 3.2Gb though
ok
could even use a gentoo minimal CD to save data downloaded
also, it's running an Intel GMA graphics thingy which apparently uses system memory
sure but not 2Gb right ;)
new install
amd just stamped 64bitness kinda first, but it will work
the intels have some amd stuff in them to help OS writing is what i heard a while back
true as it will work on any modern cpu
works great, theres a flashplugin in the repos as well as an lpha 64bit flash that might help
depends on the task, some gain speed, the apps will use the same amount of ram
i think you should look at what 64bit really means
I was thinking that since pointers are twice the size the ram usage may go up
audio / video encoding benefits from 64bit
no, thy can just use more ram effectively without having to use PAE
